DIV1.P: Mr. Prince's SERMON ON The Agency of GOD IN Droughts and Rains.
The natural and moral Government and Agency of GOD in causing Droughts and Rains.

A SERMON At the South Church in Boston, Thursday Aug. 24. 1749. Being the Day of the GENERAL THANKSGIVING, In the Province of the MASSACHUSETTS, For the extraordinary reviving Rains, after the most distressing Drought which have been known among us in the Memory of any Living.
By THOMAS PRINCE, A. M. And a Pastor of the said Church.

Q.P: Hearken unto This! — Stand still, and consider the wondrous Works of GOD!

DIV1.P: BOSTON: Printed and Sold at Kneeland and Green's, in Queen-Street, 1749.

DIV1.OPENER: IF it were not too assuming, and at so great a Distance, I would with the utmost Submission ask Leave to Dedicate the following Discourse, To the Royal Society;
DIV1.P:
—in Token of Gratitude for the many admirable and useful Disco∣veries in Nature which THEIR IL∣LUSTRIOUS MEMBERS have made and published for near ninety Years since their Institution: Whereby they have not only advanced many commodious and entertaining Arts
and Sciences; but also improved the Humane Mind in the sublimest Knowledge, cleared the Way for our admiring Views and Adorations of the SOVEREIGN CREATOR and ACTUAL RULER of the UNIVERSE, driven Atheism out of the knowing Part of the World, and obliged Multitudes in EUROPE and AMERICA: With the most servent Wishes that they may go on and prosper in their noble Designs to the Consummation of all Things—
